TopicTitle: ARM parts compatability KW/NP/Procedural Fairings, B9 .....

Articles.Content:
I am wondering what the various mod teams are planning in terms of compatability with the soon-to-be-released ARM Heavy boosters.

Supposedly they are 4.2m in diameter, so not in line with the community conventions of 3.75m or 5m.

Thus I ask, what are the plans?

I am wondering what the various mod teams are planning in terms of compatability with the soon-to-be-released ARM Heavy boosters.

Supposedly they are 4.2m in diameter, so not in line with the community conventions of 3.75m or 5m.

Thus I ask, what are the plans?

Didn't you get the memo? They ARE 3.75m parts.
I had not heard that, I thought they measured 4.2m

The question came up a few* times during the ARM Marathon, definitely 3.75m

*British Understatement

I had not heard that, I thought they measured 4.2m

GusTurbo (IIRC) tried to figure out the size of the new parts using some ratios and a pic of the parts. He came out with 4.2, but they are actually 3.75.

Considering how open and accepting Squad has been to the modding community, it would've been a monstrously idiotic move to make new stock fuel tanks incompatible with literally every single large mod tank/engine out there.

Awesome news that they are 3.75. Leaves hope for official 5m parts maybe! Just kidding, but at least I know I don't have to horribly redesign the work I've already done. Thanks for the responses, guys.

I am wondering what the various mod teams are planning in terms of compatability with the soon-to-be-released ARM Heavy boosters.

They are most likely planning on waiting to get the released version to make their mods work with the new parts.
